attributes.action: Take the advice on Brexit proposed by the former P. M. of Australia, Tony Abbott
attributes.additional_details: Sadly this petition system doesn't allow the entire text Of Mr Abbotts solution to be reproduced (its 5,000 characters, this only allows 500) so Google it please and read it.
attributes.background: It is clear that Mrs May's proposed deal is not acceptable to Government nor does it meet what the UK voted for and indeed leaves us in a worse state than being a member of the EU. Tony Abbots comments on the issue make perfect sense and is, what I believe to be what the British public voted for!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could set out clearly how you would like the UK Government to change its immigration rules and policies.
